thc vilroyeeu'MttaRahiirtah, H11 1111: 1431111111111 1:1-11¢I 11111 1111111111111111111111 1111111111 1111111111 111111111 111111 11111111111111 11111111 111111111 11111
1:11 }; 111' 1" 1le111l1l11111 11111111111 1111.11'1: 1:1 11111111111r1111111111' l1111e 11:11 111
sli11111 11:1 111111111. 1" 111'11r111111._, ,1 111 111-1111111111111 111: 1111) r" Manes. who first ruled over E ypt. in the first place protected
"Memphis by a mound; for the 111111 ele river formerly ran close to

1:111 "'1 the sandy mountain on the side of Libya; but Manes, beginning
"about a hundred stades above Memphis, filled in the elbow towards
"the south, dried up the old channel, and conducted the river into a
"canal, 111:: as to make it flew between the mountains: this bend of
"the Nile. which fluws eaelnded 11111111 -111 ..1111-.-.-.-., is still
"careful! upheld by the Persians. being made secure every year;
"for if t e river should break through and overflow in this part,
id there would be danger lest all Memphis should be flpnded. When
"the part cut "had been made firm land by this Menes, who was
first king, he in the first place built en it the city that is now called
"Memphis: for Memphis is situate in the narrow part of Egypt;
"and outside of it he excavated a lake from the river towards the
"north and the west; for the Nile itself bounds it towards the east.
"in the next place, .1111 p 11:11-1- that he built in it the temple of
"Vulcan. which is vast and well worthy of mention." 11-7111111111
